headline: Transportation ETFs Move Into Top Gear With AI in the Driving Seat
summary: Transportation ETFs like HAIL capture attention as AI-driven logistics, automation and smart mobility fuel a stronger run for the transportation sector.

raw.headline: Transportation ETFs Move Into Top Gear With AI in the Driving Seat
raw.summary: Transportation ETFs like HAIL capture attention as AI-driven logistics, automation and smart mobility fuel a stronger run for the transportation sector.

headline: Wells Fargo advises on Netflix-Warner deal in M&A win for bank
summary: The San Francisco-based lender is helping provide a $59 billion bridge loan for the deal, along with BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Holdings Plc — though Wells Fargo is the only one among the three banks to snag an all-important advisory credit.  It’s a major win for Wells Fargo, which has set out in recent years to build a muscular investment-banking franchise nearly from scratch to rival top-tier dealmakers including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.  One of the linchpins of that strategy under Fernando Rivas, chief executive officer of corporate and investment banking, has been to use Wells Fargo’s position as one of the largest US business lenders to essentially ask borrowers for a seat at the table when it comes to arranging their mergers and acquisitions.

One of the linchpins of that strategy under Fernando Rivas, chief executive officer of corporate and investment banking, has been to use Wells Fargo’s position as one of the largest US business lenders to essentially ask borrowers for a seat at the table when it comes to arranging their mergers and acquisitions.

headline: Warner-Netflix Ranks Among Biggest M&A Deals of This Year
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros. for $72 billion, or $82.7 billion including debt.   That's broadly in line with the biggest deal unveiled so far this year, the tie-up between Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern.

headline: Union Pacific (UNP): Reassessing Valuation After a Recent Share Price Rebound
summary: Union Pacific (UNP) has quietly pushed higher over the past month, with the stock up about 7%, as investors reassess rail volumes, pricing power, and what that means for longer term earnings. See our latest analysis for Union Pacific. Zooming out, that recent 7.4% one month share price return has only nudged Union Pacific to a 3.6% year to date share price gain. Its one year total shareholder return of about 3.5% signals momentum that is improving but not yet in full swing. If you are...
